definitions.definition: To have a consequence or remnant.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause or allow (something) to remain as available ; to refrain from taking (something) away; to stop short of consuming or otherwise depleting (something) entirely.
examples: I left my car at home and took a bus to work.
The ants did not leave so much as a crumb of bread.
There's not much food left . We'd better go to the shops.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive or intransitive , copulative ) To cause, to result in.
examples: The lightning left her dazzled for several minutes.
Infantile paralysis left him lame for the rest of his life.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive ) To put; to place; to deposit; to deliver, with a sense of withdrawing oneself.
examples: Leave your hat in the hall.
We should leave the legal matters to lawyers.
I left my sewing and went to the window to watch the falling snow.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive ) To let be or do without interference.
examples: I left him to his reflections.
I leave my hearers to judge.
I'll leave it to you to decide.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive ) To depart from; to end one's connection or affiliation with.
examples: I left the country and I left my wife.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive ) To end one's membership in (a group); to terminate one's affiliation with (an organization); to stop participating in (a project).
( euphemistic , transitive ) To die (the object denotes those affected by the death).
( intransitive ) To depart; to go away from a certain place or state.
( transitive ) To transfer possession of after death.
examples: When my father died, he left me the house.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive ) To give (something) to someone; to deliver (something) to a repository; to deposit .
examples: I'll leave the car in the station so you can pick it up there.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive ) To transfer responsibility or attention of (something) (to someone); to stop being concerned with.
examples: Can't we just leave this to the experts?

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , obsolete ) To remain (behind); to stay .
( transitive , archaic ) To stop , desist from; to " leave off " (+ noun / gerund).

main_definition: To have a consequence or remnant.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , obsolete ) To remain (behind); to stay .
( transitive , archaic ) To stop , desist from; to " leave off " (+ noun / gerund).

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To give leave to; allow ; permit ; let ; grant .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To give leave to; allow ; permit ; let ; grant .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , rare ) To produce leaves or foliage .

main_definition: ( intransitive , rare ) To produce leaves or foliage .
